page.title: 18ATTENBOROUGH NATURE RESERVE
page.content: { Attenborough Nature Reserve}is an area of ponds,marshland and woodland between the River Trent,a large factory and a railway line.There are many houses nearby.The ponds were once gravel pits and have been left for many years to grow wild. { Over 180 different types of bird}have been seen there,including some very rare ones seen only once.Many birds live and breed there.More different varieties of willow grow here and anywhere alse in the world. There is still gravel working going on,but the wildlife is protected.
